info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...SHOWERS WITH STRONG WINDS AND SMALL HAIL WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN NASSAU AND SOUTHWESTERN SUFFOLK COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers capable of producing winds to 45 kt and small hail along a line extending from Plainview to Freeport to Oceanside. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations that could be impacted include... Islip, Brentwood, Levittown, Freeport, Long Beach, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Plainview, Massapequa, Babylon, Patchogue, Farmingdale, Robert Moses State Park, Jones Beach and Oceanside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
